paper.title: SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccines sensitize tumours to immune checkpoint blockade

core_question: Can intratumoral delivery of an mRNA vaccine induce an interferon-rich inflammatory state that broadens antigen presentation and thereby sensitizes tumours to anti-PD-L1 immune checkpoint blockade, with supportive evidence in mice and a retrospective human cohort?

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Mouse efficacy cohort (combination therapy)
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: 78 tumor-bearing mice pooled across repeat experiments
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Preclinical pooled mouse experiments testing intratumoral mRNA vaccine in combination with anti-PD-L1, focused on tumour control and immune changes under combination treatment.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Mouse control cohort (vaccine only, ICI only, and vehicle)
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: 84 tumor-bearing mice pooled across matched controls
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Matched mouse controls spanning vaccine-only, ICI-only, and vehicle arms used to benchmark whether sensitization requires the combination and to assess null/conditional responses.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Human retrospective metastatic cohort
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Retrospective translational cohort of metastatic patients receiving ICI treatment, stratified by prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination status for a survival comparison.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Human vaccinated subgroup
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Subset of the retrospective metastatic cohort with prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination, used as the exposed group in the survival comparison under ICI treatment.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Human unvaccinated subgroup
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Subset of the retrospective metastatic cohort without prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination, serving as the comparator group for outcomes under ICI treatment.

major_limitations: Human analysis was retrospective and non-randomized, so residual confounding is likely.
Vaccination timing relative to ICI initiation varied across patients.
Tumour-type mix and treatment-history heterogeneity limits causal interpretation.
Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumours.
Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific models rather than uniform across settings.
